channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: One Dead, Six Wounded In Indianapolis Shooting

media:content.media:description: Indianapolis police chief Chris Bailey condemned recurring violence in the city's downtown area.

item.description: One person was killed and six others wounded in a shooting in the US city of Indianapolis, police said, a day after the country celebrated its independence day.
item.content:encoded: One person was killed and six others wounded in a shooting in the US city of Indianapolis, police said, a day after the country celebrated its independence day.

item.title: OPEC+ To Hike Petrol Output To 548,000 Barrels Per Day In August
item.description: Saudi Arabia, Russia and six other key members of the OPEC+ alliance said they would further increase oil output in August to 548,000 barrels per day.
item.content:encoded: Saudi Arabia, Russia and six other key members of the OPEC+ alliance said they would further increase oil output in August to 548,000 barrels per day.

item.title: Pope Leo Takes First Action To Address Abuse By Catholic Clergy
item.description: Pope Leo appointed a French archbishop as the new leader of the Vatican's commission on clergy sexual abuse, in the US pontiff's first public move to confront an issue that has damaged the global Church's credibility.
item.content:encoded: Pope Leo appointed a French archbishop as the new leader of the Vatican's commission on clergy sexual abuse, in the US pontiff's first public move to confront an issue that has damaged the global Church's credibility.

item.title: Paris Opens River Seine For Public Swimming For First Time Since 1923
item.description: Parisians rushed for a dip in the Seine as the authorities opened the river to public swimming for the first time since 1923 after an extensive clean-up operation spurred on by it being used as a venue in the Paris Olympics.
item.content:encoded: Parisians rushed for a dip in the Seine as the authorities opened the river to public swimming for the first time since 1923 after an extensive clean-up operation spurred on by it being used as a venue in the Paris Olympics.

item.title: "Mermaids Do Exist": Norwegian Singer's Performance At Women's Euro Is Viral

media:content.media:description: Astrid S rose to fame after appearing on Norway's Pop Idol in 2013.

item.description: A video of Norwegian pop artiste Astrid S delivering a beautiful rendition of Norway's national anthem at the UEFA Women's Euro 2025 has taken the Internet by storm.
item.content:encoded: A video of Norwegian pop artiste Astrid S delivering a beautiful rendition of Norway's national anthem at the UEFA Women's Euro 2025 has taken the Internet by storm.

item.title: Passengers Jump From Plane's Wing After Fire Alert On Flight Before Takeoff In Spain

media:content.media:description: The video of the incident has been going viral on social media.

item.description: At least 18 people were injured after a fire broke out on a Ryanair Boeing 737 aircraft at Palma de Mallorca Airport (PMI) in Spain. The incident occurred on Saturday, just when the Manchester-bound plane was about to take off.
item.content:encoded: At least 18 people were injured after a fire broke out on a Ryanair Boeing 737 aircraft at Palma de Mallorca Airport (PMI) in Spain. The incident occurred on Saturday, just when the Manchester-bound plane was about to take off.

item.title: 'RIP' Text Misread As Bomb Threat Forces American Airlines Flight To Divert

media:content.media:description: American Airlines flight 1847 was diverted 30 minutes after takeoff.

item.description: The woman told a stewardess about the message, who alerted the cockpit, leading to the rollout of emergency safety protocols.
item.content:encoded: The woman told a stewardess about the message, who alerted the cockpit, leading to the rollout of emergency safety protocols.

item.title: Akon's $6 Billion 'Wakanda' City Dream In Senegal Collapses. Here's What Went Wrong

media:content.media:description: The city draws comparisons to Marvel's fictional country 'Wakanda'.

item.description: Akons dream of building a futuristic $6 billion city in Senegal, modeled after Wakanda, has been reportedly shelved. The project, once hailed as a haven for the global Black diaspora, is now being replaced by a more realistic venture.
item.content:encoded: Akons dream of building a futuristic $6 billion city in Senegal, modeled after Wakanda, has been reportedly shelved. The project, once hailed as a haven for the global Black diaspora, is now being replaced by a more realistic venture.

item.title: Watch: Abu Dhabi Tests First Driverless Air Taxi, Launch Set For 2026

media:content.media:description: Abu Dhabi will serve as Archer's first international launch market.

item.description: Abu Dhabi has completed its first test flight of a driverless electric air taxi, with plans to launch commercial services by early 2026.
item.content:encoded: Abu Dhabi has completed its first test flight of a driverless electric air taxi, with plans to launch commercial services by early 2026.

item.title: Trump "Very Unhappy" With Putin Call, Says He Wants To "Keep Killing People"

media:content.media:description: Trump also hinted that he may finally be ready to toughen sanctions against Russia.

item.description: US President Donald Trump said Friday he was "very unhappy" about his telephone call with Vladimir Putin on the war in Ukraine, saying the Russian leader just wanted to "keep killing people."
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump said Friday he was "very unhappy" about his telephone call with Vladimir Putin on the war in Ukraine, saying the Russian leader just wanted to "keep killing people."

item.title: "Probably 12": Trump Signs Tariff Letters, Likely To Send By Tomorrow

media:content.media:description: The tariffs were part of a broader announcement in April.

item.description: As his July 9 deadline approaches, Trump has repeatedly said he plans to inform countries of US tariff rates by sending them letters.
item.content:encoded: As his July 9 deadline approaches, Trump has repeatedly said he plans to inform countries of US tariff rates by sending them letters.

item.title: Sports Star DJ Carey Faked Cancer Using iPhone Cord To Scam Thousands, Even Tricked A Billionaire

media:content.media:description: Former Kilkenny hurler DJ Carey has pleaded guilty to defrauding people out of money.

item.description: Irish hurling legend DJ Carey, once celebrated as a national sports icon, has pleaded guilty to a shocking cancer scam spanning nearly a decade.
item.content:encoded: Irish hurling legend DJ Carey, once celebrated as a national sports icon, has pleaded guilty to a shocking cancer scam spanning nearly a decade.

item.title: Indian-Origin Man Gets Life Term For Child's Rape In London

media:content.media:description: The police investigation was launched following reports of an attempted rape of a woman.

item.description: A 24-year-old Indian-origin man has been jailed for life following what Scotland Yard described as a "significant" police investigation into an attempted rape and rape of a child in London.
item.content:encoded: A 24-year-old Indian-origin man has been jailed for life following what Scotland Yard described as a "significant" police investigation into an attempted rape and rape of a child in London.

item.title: Odisha Man Among 3 Indians Kidnapped By Al Qaeda-Linked Group In Mali

media:content.media:description: Among those kidnapped is 28-year-old P Venkataraman, a resident of Odisha.

item.description: Three Indian nationals have been kidnapped by an Al-Qaeda-affiliated terrorist group in the West African nation of Mali. Among those kidnapped is 28-year-old P Venkataraman, a resident of Odisha's Ganjam district.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/961905/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>Three Indian nationals have been kidnapped by an Al-Qaeda-affiliated terrorist group in the West African nation of Mali. Among those kidnapped is 28-year-old P Venkataraman, a resident of Odisha's Ganjam district.

item.title: Amid Succession Planning, Dalai Lama Says He Hopes To Live For 130 Years

media:content.media:description: The Dalai Lama previously said in December he might live to 110.

item.description: Dalai Lama was speaking during a ceremony organised by his followers to offer prayers for his long life, ahead of his 90th birthday.
item.content:encoded: Dalai Lama was speaking during a ceremony organised by his followers to offer prayers for his long life, ahead of his 90th birthday.

item.title: Exclusive - Biology Beyond Earth: How Space Station Is Shaping Human Life in Space

media:content.media:description: NASA astronaut Suni Williams works on the Plant Water Management at the space station.

item.description: Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla is visiting a home away from Earth that has seen continuous human presence for a quarter of a century and is floating around 400 kilometres above Earth.

item.title: Trump Signs 'Big, Beautiful Bill' Into Law. What's Inside

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump while signing the "One Big Beautiful Bill Act"

item.description: US President Donald Trump signed into law his "One Big Beautiful Bill" at the White House on Friday, "keeping" his campaign promises of extending tax cuts from his first term and boosting military spending.

item.title: US Police Officer, 26, Dies After Undergoing Brazilian Butt-Lift Procedure

media:content.media:description: Ms Rosa paid $7,495 (approximately Rs 641,000) for the procedure.

item.description: A 26-year-old US police office has died after undergoing Brazilian Butt Lift surgery and complaining of "extreme pain" following the risky cosmetic procedure.
item.content:encoded: A 26-year-old US police office has died after undergoing Brazilian Butt Lift surgery and complaining of "extreme pain" following the risky cosmetic procedure.

item.title: 24 Killed, Over 20 Girls Missing From Summer Camp In Texas Flash Floods

media:content.media:description: Massive rescue efforts were underway to search for the missing girls.

item.description: Forecasters issued a flood warning for Kerr County, urging those living near the Guadalupe River to "move to higher ground."
item.content:encoded: Forecasters issued a flood warning for Kerr County, urging those living near the Guadalupe River to "move to higher ground."
